intro: Dichapetalum acutifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dichapetalum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and simple, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with five petals that are often pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested or grassland areas.
